intro: Nellica mendoncae, commonly known as the Mendonca's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes various bell-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its delicate, bell-like petals that range in color from white to pale blue. It typically grows in rocky soils and thrives in moist, well-drained environments. Due to its limited distribution, Nellica mendoncae is considered a rare and endangered species.
